Grilled Chicken Quinoa Salad

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a healthy and delicious meal that is both satisfying and easy to prepare? This Grilled Chicken Quinoa Salad is the perfect solution! Packed with protein from grilled chicken breast and nutrient-rich quinoa, this salad is not only filling but also bursting with fresh flavors from cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Drizzled with a zesty lemon-olive oil dressing and topped with creamy feta cheese and fresh parsley, it's an ideal dish for lunch or dinner. Whether you're meal prepping for the week or hosting a summer barbecue, this salad will impress your guests while providing a wholesome and nutritious option. Plus, it's gluten-free and can easily be customized to your taste. Dive into this vibrant, healthy dish that brings together the best of flavor and nutrition!

Ingredients

grilled chicken breast

For juicier chicken, marinate it for at least 30 minutes in olive oil, lemon juice, and your favorite herbs before grilling. If you're looking for a substitution, you can use grilled tofu or chickpeas for a vegetarian option.

quinoa

Rinse quinoa under cold water before cooking to remove its natural coating, called saponin, which can taste bitter. If you want a different grain, you can substitute quinoa with bulgur, farro, or couscous. For added flavor, cook quinoa in vegetable or chicken broth instead of water.

cherry tomatoes

Choose vibrant, firm cherry tomatoes for the best flavor. You can substitute with grape tomatoes or even diced regular tomatoes. Roasting the tomatoes before adding them to the salad can enhance their sweetness.

cucumber

Opt for English cucumbers for a sweeter, less bitter taste, and make sure to peel if desired. For a twist, use pickled cucumbers or add some diced avocado for creaminess.

red onion

Soak sliced red onion in cold water for about 10 minutes to mellow its sharpness if desired. You can substitute with green onions or shallots for a milder flavor.

feta cheese

Feta adds a tangy flavor, but if you're looking for a dairy-free option, try crumbled tofu mixed with lemon juice and nutritional yeast. For a different cheese, goat cheese or cotija can be used.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. As a substitute, avocado oil or any light oil can work, but avoid oils with strong flavors that might overpower the salad.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is ideal for brightness; bottled lemon juice can be used in a pinch, but it may lack the freshness. Lime juice can also be a good substitute for a different citrus flavor.

salt

Start with a little salt and taste as you go to avoid over-seasoning. For a different flavor profile, consider using sea salt or kosher salt.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper elevates the dish; you can also experiment with white pepper or a sprinkle of chili flakes for a spicy kick.

fresh parsley

Use flat-leaf parsley for a more robust flavor. If you don’t have parsley, fresh cilantro or basil can also provide a fresh note to the salad.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook Quinoa

    Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer to remove its bitter coating. In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed quinoa with 2 cups of water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until all the water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it sit covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and allow to cool.

  • Step 2: Grill the Chicken

    Season 1 pound of chicken breast with salt, pepper, and your favorite spices. Preheat your grill over medium-high heat. Grill the chicken for about 6-7 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C). Remove from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing into bite-sized pieces.

  • Step 3: Prepare the Vegetables

    While the chicken is resting, wash and prepare your vegetables. Halve the 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, dice 1 medium cucumber, and finely chop 1/4 cup of red onion. This will add freshness and crunch to your salad.

  • Step 4: Make the Dressing

    In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. This simple dressing will enhance the flavors of your salad.

  • Step 5: Combine Ingredients

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, sliced grilled chicken, halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, and chopped red onion. Pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine all ingredients evenly.

  • Step 6: Add Final Touches

    Before serving, sprinkle 1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley over the top of the salad. This adds a creamy texture and vibrant color.

  • Step 7: Serve and Enjoy

    Transfer the Grilled Chicken Quinoa Salad to a serving platter or individual bowls. Serve it chilled or at room temperature.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I cook quinoa properly?

To cook quinoa, rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water to remove bitterness. Combine it with 2 cups of water or broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes until the quinoa is fluffy and the water is absorbed. Let it cool before adding to your salad.

What should I look for when grilling chicken?

Ensure your chicken breast is cooked to an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). Grill each side for about 6-7 minutes, depending on the thickness. Use a meat thermometer for accuracy!

How can I safely handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw chicken. Use separate cutting boards for raw meat and vegetables to prevent cross-contamination. Clean surfaces and utensils with hot, soapy water after use.

What’s the best way to chop vegetables?

For consistent size, make sure your knife is sharp. Start by cutting off the ends of the cucumber and cherry tomatoes. Slice the cucumber in half lengthwise, then chop into half-moons. Halve the cherry tomatoes for a bite-sized addition to your salad.

How do I store leftover salad?

Store any leftover salad in an airtight container in the fridge. However, keep the dressing separate until you are ready to eat to prevent wilting.

Can I use different vegetables in this salad?

Absolutely! Feel free to add or substitute any vegetables you like, such as bell peppers, avocados, or spinach. Just make sure they are chopped into similar sizes for even distribution.

What if I don’t have feta cheese?

If you don’t have feta cheese, try substituting with goat cheese, mozzarella, or even a vegan cheese alternative. Each will give a different flavor and texture to your salad.

How can I make the dressing taste better?

Experiment with adding herbs like dill or oregano, or a splash of vinegar for extra tang. Tasting as you go is the best way to achieve your desired flavor!

What can I serve with this salad?

This salad makes a great standalone dish, but you can pair it with crusty bread, grilled vegetables, or a light soup for a complete meal.

How do I know if my chicken is done cooking?

Using a meat thermometer is the best way to check. Insert it into the thickest part of the chicken breast; it should read 165°F (75°C). Alternatively, cut into the chicken to check that the juices run clear and the meat is no longer pink.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free and can be made dairy-free by omitting the feta cheese or substituting it with a vegan cheese alternative. To make it vegan, replace the grilled chicken with chickpeas or grilled tofu, and ensure the dressing is free from honey or other animal products. This dish is also suitable for meal prepping, as the flavors meld beautifully after sitting in the refrigerator for a few hours.

Pairings

This Grilled Chicken Quinoa Salad pairs wonderfully with a light, crisp white wine such as a Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing rosé. For a non-alcoholic option, consider a sparkling water infused with lemon or cucumber. If you're looking for a protein boost, serve with grilled shrimp or salmon on the side. A light vinaigrette drizzled over the shrimp can enhance the entire dish.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the salad chilled or at room temperature to maintain the freshness of the ingredients. For a beautiful presentation, plate the salad in a large shallow bowl and garnish with additional parsley and lemon wedges. This dish is perfect for a summer picnic or a light lunch, and can be offered as a main dish or a side. For added crunch, consider topping the salad with toasted almonds or pumpkin seeds just before serving.

Grilled Chicken Quinoa Salad

$12.5
450 kcal

Description

A light and refreshing salad packed with protein and nutrients, perfect for lunch or dinner.

Ingredients

  • grilled chicken breast: 1 pound
  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup
  • cucumber: 1 medium
  • red onion: 1/4 cup
  • feta cheese: 1/2 cup
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • fresh parsley: 1/4 cup
